item.title: Report X-2024090246
item.description:
Report X-2024090246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Aaron Gutierrez Supervisor called safety to report a spill in trailer 552059, UN1139, COATING SOLUTION, 3, PG II. Aaron stated when the crew opened the doors to the trailer is when the leaking 5 gallon pail was found. Aaron stated it looks to be 12oz of the coating solution spilled on the pallet and the trailer floor. Aaron stated the bottom of the pail looks to have been damaged by the pallet it is setting on. Aaron stated he shut the trailer doors and called the spill into safety.

item.title: Report E-2024090100
item.description:
Report E-2024090100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of ink had a loosened seal and released approximately 0.9 gallon of product to the exterior of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel inspected the drum and proceeded to tighten the valves. Once crews were sure the freight was secured and no further cargo leak would occur, they staged the drum for further shipment and processing. No waste was generated during this cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2024090077
item.description:
Report E-2024090077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: SHERMAN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LSH experienced a UN3266 SK-250 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the drum lid/body only due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090087
item.description:
Report E-2024090087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LDA experienced a UN1824 Ecolab Aquanomic 2.0 Low Temp Laundry Builder release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 4' x 2' area of the trailer floor and a 5' x 10' area of the concrete lot below. It was suspected the drum was punctured by a pallet nail. Kolor-Safe neutralizer and absorbents were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum of product was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090011
item.description:
Report E-2024090011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024, at 0740 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of Techno Adhesive #199. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 110 gallons of Techno Adhesive #199 (UN1593, Adhesive, Dichloromethane (mixture), 6.1, III) from (2) 55-gallon DM’s. The release was caused by a forklift puncture and impacted 20ft x 8ft area of the trailer floor and a 20ft x 4ft area of concrete beneath the tanker. Contractors placed the 2 damaged drums into overpacks and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (7) 55-gallon DF’s and (2) 95-gallon DF overpacks then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024090036
item.description:
Report X-2024090036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE IN PD6. WHEN THE RESPONDER ARRIVED FOUND THE HAZMAT WAS WET BUT NOT ACTIVELY LEAKING. THE RESPONDER THEN CLEANED THE AREA FOLLOWING ALL DMP PROCEDURES. WHEN HE RETURNED TO DMP IT WAS FOUND THAT THE HAZMAT CONTAINED SEVERAL LEAKING CONTAINERS WITH LOOSE CAPS. THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED IN DMP WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report E-2024090008
item.description:
Report E-2024090008

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 21, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that a 55-gallon metal drum of Nipar S 10 3001 was damaged due to punctures to the top of the drum due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3110070. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with the PPE available on-site.
